arts.ttl: Marcus Rashford future addressed by Unai Emery after FA Cup display sends Aston Villa to the semi-finals
arts.sum: Aston Villa boss Unai Emery addresses the potential of the club turning Marcus Rashford's loan deal into a permanent transfer for £40m in the summer transfer window.

arts.ttl: I've been playing 'better football' since joining Villa - Rashford
arts.sum: After scoring twice against Preston, Marcus Rashford tells BBC Sport he has been playing "better football" since joining Aston Villa.

arts.ttl: Forest v Man City, Palace v Villa - semi-final draw
arts.sum: The full FA Cup semi-final draw, with ties taking place on the weekend of Saturday, 26 April.

arts.ttl: Preston’s attempts to bore Aston Villa to distraction crumble like pastry | Jonathan Liew
arts.sum: Championship perennials are beige down to their signature snack but their existence is still something to savour The man behind the counter at Greggs on Fishergate has never heard of a butter pie, but try Poundbakery over the street. Poundbakery doesn’t do butter pie, but try Greenhalgh’s on the corner. Greenhalgh’s: closed on Sundays. The chip shop on Market Street does meat pie, meat and potato, steak, steak and kidney, chicken and mushroom, cheese and onion. Butter pie? A shake of the head. You’ve got to try the butter pie. That’s what everyone says the first time you visit Preston. It was created in industrial times, for the largely Catholic working population to eat on Fridays when meat was forbidden. Often you hear it described as a “delicacy”, but even this is to overstate its intensely yeoman nature. It’s layers of potatoes, onions and butter in a pie. It’s cheap. It’s hearty. It’s unpretentious. It exists to be consumed and then immediately forgotten. It is – with deepest apologies – the very embodiment of Preston North End in comestible form. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Aston Villa and Man City set for a Blank Gameweek 34
arts.sum: Both clubs made it through to the FA Cup semi-finals today The post Aston Villa and Man City set for a Blank Gameweek 34 appeared first on Best FPL Tips, Advice, Team News, Picks, and Statistics from Fantasy Football Scout.

arts.ttl: 'That's the best way to shut people up' - why Rashford can do 'special things' at Villa
arts.sum: Mark Chapman, Micah Richards, Joe Hart and Dion Dublin analyse Marcus Rashford's man of the match performance against Preston North End as the England forward picked up his first two goals in an Aston Villa shirt.

arts.ttl: Marcus Rashford Aston Villa message after FA Cup heroics vs Preston speaks volumes
arts.sum: Marcus Rashford scored twice as Aston Villa beat Preston North End to progress into the FA Cup semi-finals at Wembley Stadium, where they will play Crystal Palace Rashford scored twice against Preston North End and helped Villa progress to the FA Cup semi-finals at Wembley Stadium, where they will play Crystal Palace .

arts.ttl: FA Cup semi-finals draw: Man City to play Forest as Palace face Villa
arts.sum: Manchester City will face Nottingham Forest in the FA Cup semi-finals while Crystal Palace will play Aston Villa.

arts.ttl: 'His swagger is back' but Villa won't 'waste time' on Rashford future
arts.sum: Aston Villa loanee Marcus Rashford scored his first goals for Aston Villa in the FA Cup quarter-final win at Preston as he continues to show some of his old swagger.

arts.ttl: Ruben Amorim's Marcus Rashford mistake becomes clearer as ex-teammate shares theory
arts.sum: Aston Villa boss Unai Emery has managed to get much better performances out of Marcus Rashford than Ruben Amorim did at Manchester United and Joe Hart believes he is getting better coaching instructions
